abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Second Road Sector Project (Chile). The
            main objective of the project was to support the
            Government's careful financial management and efficient
            execution of the road investment and maintenance program of
            the Ministry of Public Works (MOP). Based on the successful
            implementation of the previous loans, the Borrower and the
            Bank reached clear and realistic agreements on financial
            arrangements, scope of technical assistance and studies,
            programming of civil works and procurement, disbursement,
            reporting and monitoring procedures to promote achievement
            of project objectives. The project was highly successful in
            the achievement of its objectives. It achieved fully, and
            even surpassed, all objectives, particularly those related
            to institutional strengthening of, and financial allocations
            to, the road subsector, The Bank's performance during
            preparation, appraisal and implementation of the project was
            highly satisfactory and was performed with low staffing
            input. Project outcome was highly satisfactory. The main
            lesson for future projects is that their successful
            implementation will require: a) strong commitment by the
            Government, sector institutions and beneficiaries; b)
            coherent and flexible project design, based on relevancy and
            feasibility of project components; c) well-defined and
            uniform financial, institutional and procurement
            arrangements applying to the entire program, including
            externally funded projects; d) clear definition of specific
            performance targets for individual project objectives; e)
            favorable macro-economic conditions; and f) adequate
            agreements with co-financiers, particularly on harmonization
            of procurement practices.

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the Second Road
            Sector Project is to continue to support the
            Government's careful financial management through
            increasingly efficient execution of its road investment and
            maintenance program. The second objective is the
            establishment of an effectively functioning road maintenance
            and pavement management organization. This project would
            help the government by: 1) strengthening the capability of
            MOP's Road Directorate through a more focused training
            program, 2) reaching normal maintenance levels through a
            distribution of funds balanced between road investment and
            maintenance, 3) reestablishing a functional local road
            maintenance system, 4) improving Vialidad's competence
            in the economic evaluation of road construction, 5)
            resolving major traffic congestion problems, 6)
            rehabilitating road bridges and 6) assisting the Government
            in external resource mobilization for guaranteed project implementation.
